mobs.long_desc: A forest hunter regards visitors with suspicion.
mobs.desc: This leather-tough man looks like he's in early middle age. His skin is tough and scarred, and his black hair is held back neatly with a cord. He scowls most of the time, and speaks very little.

mobs.long_desc: A wild boar roots for food here.
mobs.desc: The boar has two coarse fangs, both with dried blood at the tips.  Its muscular body is aptly suited for the forest, where it is kill or be killed.  Its fur is caked in mud, with leaves and twigs sticking out here and there.

mobs.long_desc: A weary traveler makes his way through the woods.
mobs.desc: This muscular young man looks incredibly weary, and his clothes are travel-stained. His dark green eyes give him an unusual appearance.

mobs.long_desc: A bestial hunter roars as he hunts his meal.
mobs.desc: This ugly humanoid is huge, and covered in hundreds of cuts and sores. He spends his time wandering alone, roaring unintelligibly most of his waking hours. His huge forearms and thick legs bespeak monstrous strength.

mobs.long_desc: A deadly spider spins its web in a tree, awaiting its next victim.
mobs.desc: &0This spider is quite large and has huge fangs, it looks very dangerous.&0

mobs.long_desc: A forest creature hunts furtively for prey.
mobs.desc: &0This creature looks like a cross between a wolf and a bull.  It has large twisted horns on its head and a hairy muscular body.  It wanders about here in search of its next victim.  &0

mobs.long_desc: A panther prowls around here.
mobs.desc: It's a large, sleek cat with long fangs and even longer claws on each paw. It moves utterly silently, twitching its long tail when it sees prey through its round, golden eyes.

mobs.keywords: lurker pit trap sand circle ground
mobs.long_desc: A small sand-colored circle of ground lies in the path.
mobs.desc: It's six-legged, with its front two legs suited for grasping prey. There are no discernible eyes, and its hide is thick and sand-colored.

mobs.keywords: fallen nymph burning eyes fallen-nymph izaro
mobs.long_desc: A nymph with dark burning eyes peers into your soul.
mobs.desc: The fallen nymph hovers slightly off the ground.  Her red eyes burn with an anger that has driven her to insanity.  She seems to be clutching something in her hand.

mobs.long_desc: A giant black fungus grows here.
mobs.desc: The giant black fungus consists of dozens of rigid tendrils that root it to the ground, with a rounded cap at the top. Three larger, flexible tendrils wave in the wind. . . or are they waving at you?

mobs.long_desc: A black fungus is firmly rooted in the ground here.
mobs.desc: This fungus is the smaller kin of the giant fungus.  It has fewer root tendrils than the giant fungii, and has a smaller cap.  The fungus is a matte black, and it absorbs what little light reaches it. The wet forest atmosphere is a veritable breeding ground for these fungii.

mobs.long_desc: A beautiful woman clings to a tree here.
mobs.desc: The woman has flowing green hair that reaches her waist.  Her skin is a radiant bronze, and she wears an outfit made of leaves that seems to match her hair perfectly.  The scent of honeysuckle seems to eminate from her hair, although you don't see such flowers around.  She has a graceful demeanor.

mobs.long_desc: A monstrous creature made entirely of thorny vines stands guard here.
mobs.desc: The thorn monster towers above you. It seems to be entirely made of thorns; you realize it must be some sort of magical construct.  It stands facing the east, barring the way west.

mobs.long_desc: The shade of a man wearing tattered robes drifts here.
mobs.desc: The shade was once a large man with broad shoulders.  He wears robes that while once stately, are now tattered, scorched, and torn.  His eyes burn with desire for something, but it is not readily apparent what.  He paces here contemplating his situation.

mobs.long_desc: A black bird with crooked wings scurries along the ground.
mobs.desc: The taint of the forest has had an adverse affect on this birds species. Its wings are malformed, rendering it incapable of flight.  Its long black feathers stick out at odd angles, and it has a bare patch here and there.

mobs.long_desc: A tree sways back and forth in the wind.
mobs.desc: The tree looks like an ordinary tree - like any other you might find in the vicinity. However, upon further inspection, it has what seems to be a human face, contorted in agony.  Perhaps it is just a trick of the light, or perhaps some dark magic has been inflicted upon it.

mobs.long_desc: A miniature thorn beast roams about the forest.
mobs.desc: This thorn monster is rather small, but made entirely of finger thick vines with thin, almost imperceptable thorns.  At full maturity, he would be a fairly dangerous creature, but perhaps not now, since he does not yet have his "adult thorns."

mobs.long_desc: A long, thorny vine has woven itself through the underbrush here.
mobs.desc: The vine is as thick as a human's wrist, and is covered in finger long thorns.   The thorns have a black, almost dewy liquid oozing out of them, suggesting that they might be poisoned.  One end of the vine seems to be wrapped around one of the indigenous trees here, but the other end seems to roam across the ground freely.

mobs.long_desc: A cloaked elven woman rests by the spring.
mobs.desc: A tall, slender elven woman rests by the bubbling forest spring.  She wears a long cloak casually draped over her back and spread out to catch the breeze. Alongside the cloak, she carries a longbow covered in silvered runes and an ornate quiver filled with red-feathered arrows.  Her serene face is turned skyward, listening to something you can't quite make out.

mobs.long_desc: The cold North Wind blows across the land.
mobs.desc: The North Wind is a strong and powerful force, bringing bone-chilling cold with its violent temper.  Everywhere it goes snowflakes dance through its icy blasts.  It makes its home among the frozen reaches near Ickle and Mt. Frostbite.

mobs.long_desc: The blistering South Wind dessicates the land.
mobs.desc: The South Wind brings with it all the blistering heat following Midsummer like fire blowing across the world.  Crops wither in its wake and it lays the forests to rest.  It makes its home in the farthest reaches of South Caelia.

mobs.long_desc: The stormy East Wind rages with fury and bluster.
mobs.desc: The turbulent East Wind, long responsible for sinking ships by churning the oceans to froth, is the wind of storms.  It begs to run free from the volcano to return to its home on the Arabel Ocean.

mobs.long_desc: The gentle West Wind graces the land with its rejuvenating presence.
mobs.desc: The West Wind is the wind of spring flowers and green grass.  The scent of flowers and spring rain wafts from its cool, nurturing breezes.  Its home is the far reaches beyond the Gothra plains.

mobs.long_desc: A swirl of nothingness hovers above the rock.
mobs.desc: It exists, but barely so.  A swirl of something stirs up dust from the rock below but it has no definite form.

objects.ground: The ashes of an extinguished campfire lie in the middle of the clearing.

extras.text: &0It looks like a pile of cold ashes and burnt logs.  &0

objects.ground: A forest spring glistens from its rocky banks.

extras.text: Glistening, clear water burbles and chatters within the rocky banks of this pristine mountain spring.
This spear is fairly crude, and quite long.  It has a large barbed tip which serves to puncture on the way in, and rip on the way out.

objects.ground: A bark canoe has been abandoned here.

extras.text: &0It looks very heavy, but quite sturdy.  &0

objects.ground: A loincloth made of leather lies here.

extras.text: The loincloth is simply constructed of some sort of thin leather.  It covers the body's most interesting parts, with flaps hanging down the front and back.

objects.ground: A tattoo glows in the air here.

extras.text: This large tattoo covers half the face, and is shaped like a cat's striking paw, claws extended as if about to rend across the cheek from eyebrow to jawline.  It's an impressive piece.

objects.ground: A sword once used by a mighty king rests here.

extras.text: The blade is quite massive, measuring no less than four feet in length.  It's cast from sturdy steel, and decorated with precious metals and gems.  An ancient insignia marks the hilt, but has decayed to the point that it is unrecognizable.

objects.ground: A book made from the broad leaves of a tree rests here.

extras.text: The cover of the book is formed from a solid chunk of bark, with the spine made somewhat flexible by soaking it in some liquid and gently bending it into shape.  Each page seems to have once been a leaf from a local tree, torn into a roughly rectangular shape.  The writing is done in some kind of charcoal or ash - because of this, the contrast makes some of the words hard to decipher.  On the whole, the book is in fairly good shape, and is still readable. The headings in the book are PAGE1 PAGE2 . . .  PAGE8

Well, I must do something to keep myself from going mad.  I figure I shall write my thoughts, as I have an eternity to postulate about things. Why, you may ask, do I have an eternity?  Settle in, the story is quite long. Years ago, I was king of a prosperous kingdom in a land you've probably never heard of.  We farmed our land quite efficiently, and there were no major problems in the kingdom for years at a time.  Then,  I had a son, Errious, brought to me by my lovely wife.  He was a strong young lad, and quite fit to take over the throne after I passed on. He loved to travel, and over time mapped out parts of the land outside our borders, where noone in our family had likely set foot on for generations. In the process, he met a lovely elven woman by the name of Norina. He made sure to stop by her home as often as he could in his journies, often for just a day at a time, while relaxing after exploring. The text continues on PAGE2

Now, around the time that Errious was to return, I fell ill, and was bedridden for several weeks with a delierious fever. In the meantime, my wife took over rule of the kingdom, which was the norm when I was unavailable.  When my fever finally broke, I was disheartened to find out that my son had not yet returned. My wife had sent one of our finest horsemen to the area where we knew he had headed. Several days later, we found his head, and a note.  It seems that our neighbors didn't like our latest visits.  In the meantime, my wife had rallied our knights, and had sent them to attack our newfound enemies. In hindsight, it was a hasty decision.  It was a fairly even match, but because of that, the war raged on.  With our proximity, they managed to destroy our crops, and we in turn, immolated theirs.  Both sides were suffering greatly, and no real progress was being made in either's favor. The story continues on PAGE3

Finally, after several weeks of battle, both sides spirit had been broken, and we sent a courier to ask for a diplomatic meeting between their leader, Izaro, and myself.  By this point, his kingdom too was greatly suffering, and he agreed.  We agreed to meet. In the meeting we discussed the war- after saying somethings that shouldn't be said, it turned out that Errious had been seeing Norina, who was Izaro's daughter.  Alas, Norina was married to a prince from a nearby kingdom, who was helping his father put down a peasant revolt during the 'visits'. One day, he had returned to find Norina and Errious.  He claimed that Errious had killed Norina, and he defended himself.  I know that cannot be true- I raised him better than that.  More likely they were both killed in a fit of jealousy.  In either case Norina and Errious both died that day, and both our people demanded blood. The drama unfolds on PAGE4

We sent our men away, and agreed secretly to a dual to end it all.  Both our sides had lost too much, and the fighting needed to end now.  We chose to meet far away from the kingdom, and take turns leading farther into the forest, far away from any help one's kingdom could give.  It was to be a truely one on one battle. We eventually reached an area of dense forest with a clearing, and mutually decided it would be the setting of the battle.  I could tell by his ways that he was a spellcaster, and he could tell by my sword that I wasn't.  As the battle begun, I immediately rushed him, and kept him dazed enough to keep him from casting. And so the battle went.  He was a quick man, and kept from taking too many blows, but I was wearing him down.  But then, he managed to sprint out of my range, and got off one spell.  I never believed in my life that one spell could end my life, but as he finished his incantation, I looked up and saw a large ball of light, heading for me. The end is on PAGE5

The large ball of light turned out to be a burning rock, and it was quite enormous. Before I could react, it crushed me.  One spell, and I was dead.  I suppose my soul wanted vengeance.  I couldn't just die, and thus I'm here now. Somehow, he managed to capture me in this. . . room.  For some reason I can't escape. So I sit, and think, and write.  I know not what happened to Izaro- he could not have made it very far, as wounded as he was.  The forest was still full of dangerous beasts, and the smell of blood was sure to attract more. But I cannot help but feel he wasn't destroyed, otherwise why would my soul be trapped here? Someday, I will destroy him, and in doing so, hopefully be free to finally venture into the afterlife.  Until then, I write. Someday, someone may find this, and I hope it will teach them something.  War is stupid. If only I would have realized the consequences so long ago, maybe things would not be as they are.

This page consists of a number of sketches of what seems to be the same thing from different angles.  It appears to be a suit of armor with some sort of wings attached to the back of it. The wings are connected with some elaborate pulley system to the arms, giving the look of a bird which tangled itself up in a net. The caption reads 'Para-assault System'.
This page consists of a lot of doodles and nondescript drawings, but nothing of real interest.

In my time here, I have learned much about nature.  I've learned to make fire from basically nothing.  I've learned to use the remnants of that fire to write this book.  I've learned that with the right point of view, nature is a powerful entity. As such, I write the following such that you might glimpse just a touch of the powers of nature that I have learned in my many years here. May nature be there for you whenever you need her. King Thelmor Beneath the signature is a series of runes that are rather indecipherable, especially in their current condition.  It would be amazing if whatever he imbued this book with still worked.

objects.ground: A long thorn lies on the ground.
A tree here has a hollow that serves as a hidden chest.

extras.text: A false bark front conceals the hollow of this tree, concealed from the nake eye for centuries.

objects.short: a twig stuck in a rock
objects.ground: A twig is jammed into a rock that lies here.
objects.action_desc: Both the rock and the twig are rather nondescript the only strange thing is that the twig has somehow been forced into the rock.  The twig seems to be perfectly straight and cylindrical.

extras.text: Both the rock and the twig are rather nondescript the only strange thing is that the twig has somehow been forced into the rock.  The twig seems to be perfectly straight and cylindrical.

triggers.name: traveller_greet_all
triggers.commands: if %self.room% == 1802 && %actor.level% < 100 wait 1s msend %actor% Thelmor hugs you warmly. msend %actor% Thelmor tells you, 'Thank you for freeing me.' msend %actor% Thelmor mutters something about Izaro. wait 2s if %get.mob_count[1808]% == 0 msend %actor% Thelmor wails pitifully. msend %actor% Thelmor says, 'My revenge is fulfilled, and I am free!' rem blade drop blade msend %actor% Thelmor dissipates before your very eyes. if %actor.class% == Ranger && %actor.level% > 80 quest start blur %actor.name% msend %actor% A voice from the forest whispers, 'You have done the forest a great service. msend %actor% &0Meet me at the nearby spring.' endif mpurge self halt else msend %actor% Thelmor shouts, 'Izaro!  It is time to end this.' wait 2s msend %actor% Izaro streaks in from the forest. wait 1 mteleport fallen-nymph thelmor kill fallen-nymph endif endif

triggers.name: yes_to_help
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[blur]% == 0 || %actor.has_completed[blur]% wait 2s wecho A beautiful woman emerges from amongst the trees. wload mob 1811 wecho The woman smiles warmly. wait 4s wecho The woman says, 'Long ago, two men came here to duel.  Neither truly won or lost.  The forest is tainted by the malevolence each held for the other.' wait 4s wecho The woman sighs heavily. wait 2s wecho The woman says, 'One locked the other's soul in a hidden room, and threw the key into the forest.  He too had not long to live and soon perished, leaving behind a bit of himself.' wait 4s wecho The woman shakes her head, sadly. wait 2s wecho The woman says, 'The other's hatred infected the spirits of the forest, warping some of them.' wait 2s wecho The woman says, 'One in particular became so consumed by it we had to imprison her in a prison of thorns.' wait 4s wecho The woman says, 'If you could perhaps find and release the soul, perhaps they could end the duel.  Maybe then this forest will return to normal.' wait 3s wecho The woman retreats into the trees. wpurge nymph if %get.obj_count[1899]% < 2 eval keyroom 1802 + %random.13% wat %keyroom% wload obj 1899 endif endif

Meet me at the nearby spring.' endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done elseif %person.class% == Ranger && %person.level% > 80 && !%person.quest_stage[blur]% quest start blur %person.name% msend %person% A voice from the forest whispers, 'You have done the forest a great service.  Meet me at the nearby spring.' endif

Begone!" mechoaround %actor.name% The void guardian envelops %actor.name%, who disappears. msend %actor.name% The void guardian envelops you, and you find yourself elsewhere. mteleport %actor.name% 1841 else wait 1s mecho The void guardian growls and says, "You think this will appease me?  BAH!" end end mjunk %object.name%

triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.class% /= Ranger bow %actor% say Welcome fellow warden. wait 1s else mecho %self.name% says, 'Greetings traveler.  Be careful, this forest can mecho &0be... unpredictable.' endif if %actor.quest_stage[blur]% == 1 mecho %self.name% says, 'I see you have brought peace to the forest.  I am mecho &0impressed.  Perhaps you are ready to learn the deeper ways of nature?' elseif %actor.quest_stage[blur]% == 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'The Syric Warder still lives.  Relieve him of his mecho &0endless vigil.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[blur]% == 3 say Let me have the Warder's sword. elseif %actor.quest_stage[blur]% == 4 say Are you ready to race the four winds? elseif %actor.has_failed[blur]% say Back again I see.  Ready to try again? endif

triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[blur]% == 1 mecho A twinkle shines in %self.name%'s eye. say I had hoped so. quest advance blur %actor.name% wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'There is a very powerful spell only we warriors of mecho &0nature know.  If you prove yourself worthy, you will be able to learn it as mecho &0well.  Helping the forest was a demonstration of the purity of your spirit, but mecho &0you must now prove your strength.' wait 4s mecho %self.name% says, 'There is a warder who failed to protect a massive mecho &0swath of the west from being consumed by the Realm of Dreams.  Since his mecho &0failure, he has become part of the Dream, fallen completely to nightmare.' wait 4s say End his suffering and bring me his blade. wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'Check with me if you want to know your &7&b[progress]&0.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[blur]% == 4 if %speech% /= yes || %speech% /= ready mecho %self.name% says, 'You will only have one day to race all four winds, mecho &0and even less time for each wind individually.' mecho mecho %self.name% says, 'If after one day you have not completed all four mecho &0of their challenges, you will have to come back to me to start again.' wait 4s mecho %self.name% says, 'When you are ready, say &7&b[let's begin]&0.' endif elseif %actor.has_failed[blur]% && (%speech% /= yes || %speech% /= ready) quest restart blur %actor.name% quest advance blur %actor.name% quest advance blur %actor.name% quest advance blur %actor.name% mecho %self.name% says, 'Then you will need to find the winds again and race them. mecho &0You have one day to complete their challenges.' wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'When you are ready, say &7&b[let's begin]&0.' endif

triggers.name: blur_ranger_receive
triggers.commands: if %object.vnum% == 58420 if %actor.quest_stage[blur]% == 3 quest advance blur %actor.name% wait 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'Thank you for ending his suffering.  That was a mecho &0truly heroic effort.' wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'But this test is about more than just strength. mecho &0The true signature of a ranger is speed.' wait 2s emote whistles a complex tune to the sky and listens. wait 8s mecho A breeze rustles the leaves of the trees. wait 3s emote smiles. wait 1s nod wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'Your true teachers will be the four winds.  I have mecho &0called out to them.  They have agreed to teach you the spell if you can pass mecho &0the test we all have passed.' wait 5s say You must best them in a race. wait 4s mecho %self.name% says, 'The four winds are notoriously difficult to locate. mecho &0The North Wind blows through the frozen town of Ickle. mecho &0The South Wind blows around the hidden standing stones in South Caelia. mecho &0The East Wind blows through an enormous volcano in the sea. mecho &0The West Wind blows through ruins across the vast Gothra plains.' wait 7s mecho %self.name% says, 'You may challenge them in any order, but even if mecho &0you find where the winds blow, there may be additional challenges to connecting mecho &0with them.' wait 5s give forgotten-kings %actor% say You may need this. wait 4s mecho %self.name% says, 'Are you ready to try?' elseif %actor.quest_stage[blur]% == 2 return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'It seems the Warder still roams.  Please go back and mecho &0destroy him.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[blur]% > 3 return 0 wait 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'You have already brought me %object.name%. mecho &0Please, keep it.' endif elseif %actor.quest_stage[blur]% == 3 return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 say This is not the proper blade. else return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 say I have no need for this at the moment. endif

triggers.name: blur_ranger_speech2

rooms.name: Before the Great Plains
rooms.description: The forest is quite thick here.  A barely-visible path meanders south through masses of spiny, thorny vines; there is no further sign of it to the north.  To the south the forest lightens slightly, but it remains an endless sea of dark trunks and shadows.

rooms.name: Approaching the Great Plains
rooms.description: The forest is still quite thick here, and there is a thick undergrowth of thorny, spiny vines beneath the bushy trees.  To the north the trail becomes fainter, as the vines encroach and shadows grow deeper.

rooms.name: A Forest Prison
rooms.description: The archway leads into a small room like clearing.  The walls and ceiling are composed of numerous twisted trees, which form almost perfectly straight barriers.  The trees grow so tightly that nary a single beam of light can sneak through.  It seems to have been designed as a prison for someone, or something. The only exit is to the east, where the archway leads back into the forest proper.

rooms.name: A Junction
rooms.description: The forest path meets a junction here where a small, narrow path shoots off the main trail northwards.  The main trail continues to the west however it appears to be extremely thick further along the trail suggesting perhaps the trail to the north has now replaced it.  To the north the trees seem to be much thicker and bushier, suggesting they get more light than those in the rest of the forest.  To the east the trail continues into the eerie darkness.

West.description: To the west, two black barked trees intertwine, creating a lovely little archway.  The archway is blocked by numerous smaller trees.

rooms.name: Around a Huge Ancient Tree
rooms.description: The dark trail bends to the west and south here as it goes around a huge tree trunk, which lies to the southwest.  The trunk is extremely wrinkly and looks centuries old.  The trunk rises high into the forest canopy and large, heavy branches extend out over the area, cloaking the trail in an eerie darkness.  Splinters of light penetrate the canopy high above, barely illuminating the trail.

rooms.name: Along the Forest Trail
rooms.description: The trail is quite dark and eerie here.  In every direction the ghostly trunks of ancient trees form an army of silent warriors that watch every movement.  There is a strange silence that echoes throughout the area.  To the west lies the trunk of a huge, ancient tree that is covered in large knots and wrinkles, which almost resemble a lifelike face, with outreaching branches far above in the overhanging canopy.

rooms.name: Around a Huge Ancient Tree
rooms.description: The dark trail bends to the west and north here as it goes around a huge tree trunk, which lies to the northwest.  The trunk is extremely wrinkly and looks centuries old.  The trunk rises high into the forest canopy and large, heavy branches extend out over the area, cloaking the trail in an eerie darkness.

rooms.name: A Narrow Section
rooms.description: The forest trail is quite narrow here due to the trunk of a huge ancient tree to the north and an outcrop of spiny, thorny bushes to the south.  There is sufficient room to pass, but travel in any other direction would be impossible.  The trail continues to the west and east.

rooms.name: A Sharp Bend in the Forest Trail
rooms.description: The trail bends sharply to the east and south here due to the trunks of numerous trees that have fused together over many centuries forming an impenetrable wall to the north and west.  To the northeast the huge trunk of an ancient tree fills the entire area.  Its huge branches hang down like fingers from the canopy high above covering the trail.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Forest Trail
rooms.description: The shadowy forest continues here as the tall, ancient trunks of the endless sea of trees that surround the pathway form a gray, eerie wall.

rooms.name: Within the Forest of Shadows
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb-infested underbrush surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The ground is covered in many small footprints.

rooms.name: A Narrow, Watery Section of the Trail
rooms.description: The trail narrows here as the thick bushy undergrowth of the surrounding forest overhangs the trail.  There is a lot of water on the ground here causing a sloshy, muddy texture in the trail.  It would seem there is a supply of water nearby, perhaps a spring.

rooms.name: A Junction
rooms.description: The main forest path is met here by a gravel path which runs off to the west.  The gravel path does not quite meet the forest path and there is a large, dead bushy tree blocking the gravel path from the main.  It would seem that this path was deliberately not joined to the main path and was once hidden from view, but due to this tree dying this is no longer so.  The destination of the gravel path is unclear.

rooms.name: Along a Gravel Path
rooms.description: &0This pathway appears to have been made intentionally as the gravel that lines the path does not stray from the main path.  It was most certainly constructed.  The path ends suddenly to the east here behind a large dead tree. It would seem that this path was once used to access the main forest path that lies to the east but was intentionally not joined so that its presence was not located by normal travelers.  However, now that this tree has died the main forest path can easily be seen through the thinned branches - and no doubt this path can be seen from the other side.  &0

West.description: A set of long branches bars your path to the west.

rooms.name: The End of a Gravel Path
rooms.description: &0This pathway is lined with coarse, gray gravel, which appears to have been deliberately laid here to construct this path.  The path itself winds gently through the thick forest to the east.  On both sides of the path are thick, bushy, spiny plants scattered by enormous ancient trunks that rise up high into the canopy above.  Travel to the north, west, or south would be extremely difficult.  &0

East.description: A set of long branches serves as a door to the east.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Forest Trail
rooms.description: The shadowy forest continues here as the tall, ancient trunks of the endless sea of trees that surround the pathway form a gray, eerie wall.  The pathway continues to the north and east.

rooms.name: Within the Forest of Shadows
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb-infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The ground is covered in many small footprints.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Forest Trail
rooms.description: The shadowy forest continues here as the tall, ancient trunks of the endless sea of trees that surround the pathway form a gray, eerie wall.  The pathway continues to the north and west.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Forest Trail
rooms.description: The shadowy forest continues here as the tall, ancient trunks of the endless sea of trees that surround the pathway form a gray, eerie wall.  The pathway continues to the south and east.

rooms.name: Within the Forest of Shadows
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb-infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The ground is covered in many small footprints.

rooms.name: A Colorful Stone in the Path
rooms.description: The forest path bends sharply to the west and south here.  In the north eastern corner of the area is a large colorful stone which appears to signify the beginning of a thin pathway that leads off to the east.  The tiny pathway appears to be lined with many colorful stones, most curious.

rooms.name: A Trail Lined with Colorful Stones
rooms.description: This thin trail looks different from the rest of the forest trail in that it is lined with many colorful stones of all descriptions.  To the west the forest trail continues into the distance whilst to the north the stone lined trail continues.

rooms.name: Before a Small Forest Hut
rooms.description: The forest path ends here at the entrance to a small forest hut which lies to the east.  There is a few colorful rocks that have been specifically placed around the entrance to decorate it suggesting this little hut may actually be occupied.  To the south the forest trail continues.

East.description: The bark of the tree has a strange look to it.

rooms.name: A Small Forest Hut
rooms.description: This little room is little more than some branches that have been carefully twined together to form a semi-sturdy structure.  The roof is lined with a thick mat of large leaves which offer some sort of protection from the elements.  The door to the hut is made from a large piece of bark which, although thin, looks quite tough and strong.  There is a small opening in the ceiling to the north of the hut which appears to be to let smoke out.  &0

West.description: A section of bark makes up the door to the hut.

rooms.name: Within the Forest of Shadows
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb-infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The ground is covered in many small footprints.

rooms.name: Within the Forest of Shadows
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb-infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The ground is covered in many small footprints.

rooms.name: Around the Huge Boulder
rooms.description: The forest path bends around the huge boulder to the west.  The trail itself is lined with a large amount of black material, which appears to have come from the boulder itself.  It would seem many years of weathering are taking its toll on this huge landmark.

rooms.name: Before a Huge Boulder
rooms.description: The forest trail diverts to the east and west here due to a huge boulder that lies directly to the south.  The boulder looks quite weathered suggesting it has been here for many many years.  A thick layer of slippery, green slimy moss has grown over the boulder's surface making it impossible to climb over. Many plants have taken root in the cracks over the boulder which slowly contribute to the weathering process.

rooms.name: Around the Huge Boulder
rooms.description: The forest path bends around the huge boulder to the east.  The trail itself is lined with a large amount of black material, which appears to have come from the boulder itself.  It would seem many years of weathering are taking its toll on this huge landmark.

rooms.name: Near a Forest Clearing
rooms.description: The trail makes its way north and south here.  To the west lies a huge black boulder and to the west lies an endless sea of thick undergrowth and trees. To the south the trail seems to open up significantly as the forest clears. It appears that there is a large forest clearing further in that direction.

rooms.name: Near a Forest Clearing
rooms.description: The trail makes its way north and south here.  To the west lies a huge black boulder and to the east lies an endless sea of thick undergrowth and trees. To the south the trail seems to open up significantly as the forest clears. It appears that there is a large forest clearing further in that direction.

rooms.name: A Grassy Forest Clearing
rooms.description: This area is deep within the Forest of Shadows and for some reason does not support any tree life.  The land slopes away to the south away from the huge boulder that lies to the northeast suggesting it make be the cause of the lack of plant life.  Regardless of the reason, this clearing is a nice change from the dull, eerie forest paths that lie all around this area.  A trail leads off north.

rooms.name: Before a Huge Boulder
rooms.description: A huge boulder dominates the grassy clearing to the north.  To the east and west the grassy clearing continues and leads around this huge boulder.  To the south the grassy clearing continues into the distance.

rooms.name: A Grassy Forest Clearing
rooms.description: This grassy area is deep within the Forest of Shadows and supports no tree life at all.  The large open, airy space provides a welcome alternative to the dull, eerie forest paths that dominate the surrounding areas.  The grass here is quite yellow rather than green suggesting the soil here has been tainted with something that stunts plant growth.

rooms.name: A Thin Forest Path
rooms.description: This thin pathway leads back into the thick forest away from the open grassy clearing to the east.  Even though it is so close to the clearing, this forest is as thick as any part of this eerie forest.  To the west the thin pathway leads into the endless sea of spiny bushes and ancient trees.

rooms.name: A Sharp Bend
rooms.description: The forest path bends sharply here to the east and south.  The thick, cobweb infested understory is an eerie backdrop to this dull forest path making it look almost dusted with spider webs.  To the east the trail continues into the distance, while to the south something can be seen glistening through the thick bushes.

rooms.name: A Forest Spring
rooms.description: The trail ends here, at a large spring.  The water looks very clean, with some normal plant life fringing the waters.  This spring offers some refuge from the forest around you, as no creature seems to approach you here.

rooms.name: Within the Grassy Forest Clearing

rooms.name: A Well Travelled Path
rooms.description: This thin pathway leads back into the thick forest away from the open grassy clearing to the west.  Even though it is so close to the clearing, this forest is as thick as any part of this eerie forest.  To the east the thin pathway leads into the endless sea of spiny bushes and ancient trees.

rooms.name: Before a Hollowed Tree
rooms.description: This path looks quite well traveled as there is little vegetation growing from the brown trail.  To the south is the entrance to a large ancient tree which appears to have been carved out.  The entrance is quite large and it looks like it would provide considerable shelter from the elements.  Who carved the tree is unknown but it is possible this tree may still be the home to someone - or something.

rooms.name: Within an Ancient Hollowed Tree
rooms.description: &0This tree is huge and must have been standing here for many many centuries.  The inside of the tree has been carved out however it does not seem to have effected the health of the tree too much.  In the centre of the tree is a large campfire suggesting this place is often used by travelers through the forest as a means of protection from the elements.  Although quite wide, whoever carved the tree did not carve very high making it impossible to move further up within the tree.  &0

rooms.name: Before a Hollowed Tree
rooms.description: This path looks quite well traveled as there is little vegetation growing from the brown trail.  To the south is the entrance to a large ancient tree which appears to have been carved out.  The entrance is quite large and it looks like it would provide considerable shelter from the elements.  Who carved the tree is unknown but it is possible this tree may still be the home to someone - or something.

rooms.name: Within an Ancient Hollowed Tree
rooms.description: &0This tree is huge and must have been standing here for many many centuries.  The inside of the tree has been carved out however it does not seem to have effected the health of the tree too much.  In the centre of the tree is a large campfire suggesting this place is often used by travelers through the forest as a means of protection from the elements.  Although quite wide, whoever carved the tree did not carve very high making it impossible to move further up within the tree.  &0

rooms.name: A Well Traveled Path
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The path looks like it has been trodden down for many years now.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Forest Path
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The narrow path winds its way through the trees, heading generally north and west.

rooms.name: A Well Traveled Path
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The path looks like it has been trodden down for many years now.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Forest Trail
rooms.description: The shadowy forest continues here as the tall, ancient trunks of the endless sea of trees surrounding the pathway form a grey, eerie wall.  The pathway continues to the south and east.

rooms.name: Along the Forest Trail
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The ground is covered in many small and strange footprints.

rooms.name: Approaching a Sandy Bank
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The ground is covered in many small and strange footprints.

rooms.name: Before a Sandy Bank
rooms.description: The forest is quite dense here; however, it begins to thin to the east, where it opens up into a sandy bank.  The glistening of the light reflecting off the waterway to the east makes it way through the swaying undergrowth of the forest.

rooms.name: A Sandy Bank
rooms.description: This area is a small sandy bank which separates the waterway to the east from the dense forest to the west.  The sand is covered in footprints, suggesting this area is commonly used by travelers as a place to access both the forest and whatever lies beyond this bank.  &0

rooms.name: Within the Grassy Forest Clearing
rooms.description: This grassy area is deep within the Forest of Shadows and supports no tree life at all.  The large open, airy space provides a welcome alternative to the dull, quiet forest paths that dominate the surrounding areas.  The grass here is quite yellow, rather than green, suggesting the soil here has been tainted with something that stunts plant growth.

rooms.name: Approaching a Forest Clearing
rooms.description: The forest begins to thin to the north here, and a large grassy clearing can be seen through the branches as the wind sways them to and fro.  The forest trail continues to the north and south whilst to the east and west the endless sea of dense spiny bushes and ancient tree trunks makes travel in those directions virtually impossible.

rooms.name: Within the Forest of Shadows
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The ground is covered in many small and strange footprints.

rooms.name: A Narrow Section of Trail
rooms.description: One of many huge ancient trees lies to the south here, making travel in that direction impossible.  The trail bends sharply to the north and east whilst to the west lies a wall of spiny, thorny bushes preventing access.

rooms.name: Around a Huge, Ancient Tree
rooms.description: The dark trail bends to the west and south here as it goes around a huge tree trunk which lies to the southwest.  The trunk is extremely wrinkly and looks centuries old.  The trunk rises high into the forest canopy and large, heavy branches extend out over the area, cloaking the trail in an eerie darkness.  Splinters of light penetrate the canopy high above, barely illuminating the trail.

rooms.name: Along the Forest Trail
rooms.description: The trail is quite dark and eerie here.  In every direction, the ghostly trunks of ancient trees form an army of silent warriors that watch every movement.  There is a strange silence throughout the area.  To the west lies the trunk of a huge, ancient tree that is covered in large knots and wrinkles which almost resemble a lifelike face, its arms the outreaching branches far above in the overhanging canopy.

rooms.name: Around a Huge, Ancient Tree
rooms.description: The dark trail bends to the west and north here as it goes around a huge tree trunk which lies to the northwest.  The trunk is extremely wrinkly and looks centuries old.  The trunk rises high into the forest canopy and large, heavy branches extend out over the area cloaking the trail in an eerie darkness.  Splinters of light penetrate the canopy high above, barely illuminating the trail.

rooms.name: A Narrow Section of Trail
rooms.description: One of many huge ancient trees lies to the north here, making travel in that direction impossible.  The trail bends sharply to the east and south whilst to the west lies a wall of spiny, thorny bushes, preventing access in that direction.

rooms.name: An Open Section of the Forest
rooms.description: The forest canopy is quite open here, due to a large ancient tree that has recently fallen over.  Hundreds of smaller trees are taking advantage of the extra light and struggling to out grow each other in an attempt to take their proud place in the forest.  However, this has left a significantly large area of the forest relatively open temporarily.

rooms.name: A Dead End
rooms.description: The forest path comes to an end here.  It would seem the thickness of the thorny bushes in the undergrowth was just too much for the people making the trail, and it ends very abruptly, among trees and thorns.  It extends to the east.

rooms.name: An Open Section of Forest
rooms.description: The forest canopy is quite open here due to a large ancient tree that has recently fallen over.  Hundreds of smaller trees are taking advantage of the extra light and struggling to out grow each other in an attempt to take their proud place in the forest.  However, this has left a significantly large area of the forest temporarily open.

rooms.name: Before a Clearing
rooms.description: The trail here is brighter than to the east due to a thin section in the forest to the west.  The reason why the canopy is so open to the west is unclear from here but travel looks easy in that direction.

rooms.name: Along the Forest Trail
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The ground is covered in many small and strange footprints.

rooms.name: A Narrow Section of Trail
rooms.description: The forest trail is quite narrow here due to the trunk of a huge ancient tree to the north and an outcrop of spiny, thorny bushes to the south.  There is sufficient room to pass, but travel in any other direction would be impossible.  The trail continues to the west and east.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Forest Trail
rooms.description: The trail bends to the south and west here as it winds through the thick thorny bushes.  The ground here is quite moist, suggestive of a spring nearby, but none can be seen or heard from here.

rooms.name: Within the Forest of Shadows
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The ground is covered in many small and strange footprints.

rooms.name: Within the Forest of Shadows
rooms.description: This section of the narrow trail looks very similar to the rest of the forest, with many grey-green trees pressing together against the overgrown path.  The forest seems eerily quiet around here.

rooms.name: Within the Forest of Shadows
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The ground is covered in many small and strange footprints suggesting this forest is not as dead as it appears.

rooms.name: Near Some Cobwebs
rooms.description: Masses of cobwebs bind the thorny bushes in the immediate area here causing them to take on the appearance of large silken bags.  Closer inspection reveals thousands of tiny fanged spiders covering the webs, all hungry for any prey that wanders past.

rooms.name: A Junction in the Forest
rooms.description: There is a trail leading off the east here which looks far less traveled than the ones to the north and west.  The reason for this is unclear, but may have to do with the trees that press in close together around the narrow trail.

rooms.name: Dead End
rooms.description: It looks as though this path once continued through the forest to the south however, it looks as though the dark forest has long ago reclaimed the path. Sundry vines and trees have formed a substantial barrier perhaps someday will reopen this path.  Perhaps the forest will have its way, instead.

rooms.name: An Artificial Void
rooms.description: An expanse of bare, reddish-brown rock stretches as far as visible.  No plant life is visible in the area, no other signs of life at all.  The sky is a murky brown, as well, blending in with the ground.  The whole plase is dreary and desolate.  Who or what created this place remains a mystery, but it is definitely not natural.

rooms.name: Within the Forest of Shadows
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The ground is covered in many small and strange footprints.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Forest Path
rooms.description: The trail bends to the east and south here and continues into the distance through the dense masses of thorny bushes and trees.  Traveling here is quite easy, as the trail is wide and obviously well used.

rooms.name: Along the Trail
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The ground is covered in many small and strange footprints.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Forest Path
rooms.description: A wall of ancient trees to the east has caused this sharp bend in the trail to the north and west.  Many footprints cover the ground suggesting many travelers use this route to the visit the lands both to the north and the south.

rooms.name: Within the Forest of Shadows
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The ground is covered in many small and strange footprints, suggesting this forest is not as dead as it appears.

rooms.name: A Sharp Bend
rooms.description: The trail bends sharply to the east and south here as it winds it was through the forest.  The ground is quite moist, with large pools of water infested with insects and mosquitos formed here and there.  Apart from those, the trail looks quite safe to travel.

rooms.name: Along the Trail
rooms.description: This section of the forest path looks very similar to the rest of the forest.  The endless sea of tree trunks and thick, cobweb infested understory surrounds the pathway.  Splinters of light which find their way through the swaying canopy high above barely illuminate the area.  The ground is covered in many small and strange footprints suggesting this forest is not as dead as it appears.

rooms.name: Within the Forest of Shadows
rooms.description: The wide forest trail makes easy traveling here.  The lack of vegetation on the ground suggests this trail is often traveled and for that reason there is more than just the forest creatures to fear while traveling it.  The trail extends to the north and south past amorphous, gray trees.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Forest Trail
rooms.description: The shadowy forest ends here as the tall ancient trunks of the sea of trees gives way to rolling hills.  A path through the hills lie to the west, while the eerie forest continues to the north.

rooms.name: Deep in the Forest
rooms.description: The gray trees here form a literall wall.  All about, the branches and bramble intertwine, making it impossible to penetrate into the forest.  The only available direction of travel is to the south, where this clearing continues.

rooms.name: Deep in the Forest
rooms.description: The gray trees here form a literall wall.  All about, the branches and bramble intertwine, making it impossible to penetrate into the forest.  The only available direction of travel is to the north, where this clearing continues.
